"Man, these skins are just so gorgeous and detailed."

Blizzard proceeding to put them behind a $40 paywall:
still same game when I bought as overwatch 1. now its just on steam..

Overwatch "2" still hasn't given all of the shit we were promised in the trailers, WHERE THE FUCK ARE THE INSPECT ANIMATIONS FOR THE GUNS BLIZZARD WE SAW THEM IN THE FUCKING TRAILER GIVE THEM TO US
SAME THING WITH THE JUNKERQUEEN STATUE WHERE THE HELL IS IT BLIZZARD

Don't let the "Blizzard Entertainment, Inc." developer & publisher fool you. The Blizzard people loved for so long has been dead for years. It is a corpse puppet Activision uses for marketing purposes, that is all.

Overwatch 1 wasn't a perfect game, not by a long shot. But Overwatch 2 is a worse version of Overwatch 1 in every single way. Lets see what bad design choices fall onto the tracks as my train of thought gets rolling...

I will preface this with the fact that if they didn't take Overwatch 1 away from everyone that bought it I wouldn't give a shit that they released a inferior Free2Play sequel, I would just go play that.

5v5 sucks horsecock, I don't give a fuck what streamers, pros, or the devs say. The majority of players are not pros, if the balance of Overwatch 2 built around such a small segment of the community its no wonder people are quitting the game. Its not like 6v6 was ever perfectly balanced, but I think that it allowed for a bit more freedom when it came to counter-picking. I know that counter-picking is big part of the game and always has been, but 5v5 has made it almost impossible to have fun in the game without selecting meta characters/hard counters (this is doubly true for tanks).
6v6 enabled soft-countering, which made it possible for people to play characters they enjoy. It allowed people to pick someone they wanted to play that could contribute to dealing with a particular threat without putting it all on their shoulders. It meant that success or failure in a fight wasn't down to just 1 player death on 1 team deciding who wins that engagement. Also many of the tanks in Overwatch were never built with solo tanking in mind and without complete reworks never can.
I know some will say 5v5 was done to solve shield meta. But how fuck is changing the game to 5v5 and then trying to re-balance everything off that easier than just re-balancing some shield users or their counters?
5v5 is why Open Queue and Mystery Heroes are the only main modes its possible to have some fun in.

Push sucks horseballs. Assault had its issues, but push just feels like you are going nowhere fast escorting a idiotic robot back and forth(What the fuck is it pushing? A tall jersey barrier?). Its entirely possible the whole match will take place in quarter of the map as both teams just trade the bot and it goes barely farther one way than the other. You don't feel like anything was accomplished. But its probably a good thing cause the map design is just a lazy mirrored layout. At least with Assault you could change tactics and lineup based on location. And sure some games were steamrolls on attack or defense, but at least it was quick. 

Charging for early access to characters is pay to win. Just because they can EVENTUALLY be earned doesn't mean they aren't pay to win. And just because other games do it doesn't mean its acceptable. Its a scumbag move no matter who does it. Overwatch 2 coulda earned a couple positive points on the shit meter if they didn't do it.

What can I say that hasn't already been said about the overpriced cosmetics? Well I could say how they converted Overwatch 1 players' in-game currency into the least valuable type of 3 currencies in Overwatch 2. And how the legendary skins of Overwatch 1 became only available for the 2nd most valuable currency of Overwatch 2. Essentially anyone who hadn't already spent their Overwatch 1 currency had it turned from "real" money into monopoly money as far as the game was concerned. But I guess if Activision is willing to steal the game we paid for from us, it is willing to steal our time and money also. They did end up changing this so the old skins were obtainable with that monopoly money, but it doesn't change the fact that they tried to do it. And the new "gold" currency is such a fucking grind to obtain its not even worth trying to get it. Essentially its give them money or you cant get anything new that is cool.

Do I even need to talk about the removal of the PvE campaign? How they cancelled it internally at least a year before Overwatch 2 was released but were perfectly happy to use it to market the game and sell garbage for 6 months after release. If you look at the Invasion menu in-game you can even see the broken, frankensteined together hunks of flesh that were gathered from the meat and soul grinder they put their lower level employees into.

The moral of the story: Stop giving this god damned company your money. It is the only way they will EVER do better.

PS I'm calling it now they are going to try to sell us Overwatch Classic
